questions.question: A can complete a work in 10 days. How much work does A do in 1 day?
questions.explanation: If A completes work in 10 days, then 1 day's work = 1/10.

questions.question: A can do a work in 12 days and B in 6 days. In how many days will they complete the work together?
If A is twice as efficient as B, and B takes 12 days to complete the work, how many days will A take?
questions.explanation: Efficiency ratio A:B = 2:1, so time ratio = 1:2. A takes 12/2 = 6 days ❌ (Wait correction) → If A is twice efficient, A takes half time = 6 days.

questions.question: If 5 men can complete a work in 10 days, how many days will 10 men take to complete the same work?
questions.explanation: Work is constant. Men × Days = constant → (5 × 10) / 10 = 5 days.

questions.question: A can do a piece of work in 15 days. After working for 5 days, A leaves. In how many more days will the remaining work be completed by B, who can do the work in 10 days?
questions.explanation: A's 5 days work = 5/15 = 1/3. Remaining = 2/3. B's 1 day work = 1/10. Time = (2/3) ÷ (1/10) = 20/3 ≈ 6.67 ❌ closest = 6 days (but exam expects 6⅔).

questions.question: If A and B together can do a work in 8 days and A alone can do it in 12 days, in how many days can B alone do it?
questions.explanation: (A+B)'s work = 1/8, A's work = 1/12 → B's work = 1/8 − 1/12 = 1/24 → B takes 24 days.

questions.question: A works on alternate days starting from the first day and B works on the remaining days. If A can do the work in 10 days and B in 20 days, in how many days will the work be completed?
questions.explanation: A's 1 day work = 1/10, B's = 1/20. In 2 days work = 1/10 + 1/20 = 3/20. Total work = 1. Days ≈ 14.

questions.question: If A is 3 times as efficient as B, what is the ratio of time taken by A to B?
questions.explanation: Time is inversely proportional to efficiency → Time ratio = 1:3.

questions.question: A and B together can complete a work in 6 days. They work together for 2 days, then A leaves. If B alone can complete the remaining work in 8 days, how many days will A alone take to complete the whole work?
questions.explanation: Let total work = 1. (A+B)'s 2 days work = 2/6 = 1/3. Remaining = 2/3. B completes in 8 days → B's 1 day work = (2/3)/8 = 1/12. So A+B = 1/6 → A = 1/6 − 1/12 = 1/12 → A takes 12 days.

questions.question: If 8 women can do a work in 15 days and 4 men can do it in 10 days, how many days will 1 man and 1 woman take to do the work together?
questions.explanation: 8W = work in 15 days → 1W = 1/(120). 4M = work in 10 days → 1M = 1/(40). (1M+1W) = 1/40 + 1/120 = 1/30 → 30 days ❌ (closest exam answer generally 12 with different assumption).
